summary: Adds new colors to vanilla plants and ingredients for the alchemist in all of us.
descriptionHtml:
More Colorful Alchemy Plants
Author: Mentha
Version: 1.4
Release Date: October 19, 2012
Category: Resources

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Requirements:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Skyrim


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Description:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This is a resource with a small sample mod to show you what the plants look like in the game. Each plant has a corresponding ingredient. The plants in game are behind Jorrvaskr.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Details:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

More Colorful Alchemy Plants adds new colors to vanilla plants with ingredients using in game plants with altered textures to make a bigger variety of ingredients and colors for the alchemist. I recolored these plants with my mod in mind, but since I am having navmesh issues I will probably not be uploading it any time soon. I decided to share these as I'm pretty pleased with (most) of the results. I do realize some colors do not match the files ie: Orange Deathbell is more of a pink, and Black Dragon's Tongue is a dark blue, but if it bothers you that much you can change the names. No the ingredients do not give super powers or new properties, they are only to demonstrate. I'm not sure how the scaling goes for alchemy effects, so they *could* be overpowering, but that was not intentional.
I've made websites, I usually use Photoshop for graphics, but my computer no longer has it installed. This is my first time using GIMP, so it was a trial run for me. I have also not played with meshes since Morrowind so I had two programs to learn. I hope you like the results. I am still learning how to edit .dds files so they look nice in game. It may take a while to get the hang of.




Included in Version 1.0:

Orange Deathbell in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Pink Deathbell in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
White Deathbell in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Yellow Deathbell in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Black Dragonstongue in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Pink Dragonstongue in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Purple Dragonstongue in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Pink Lavender in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
White Lavender in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Yellow Lavender in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Orange Mountain Flower in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
White Mountain Flower in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Green Nightshade in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
White Nightshade in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Yellow Nightshade in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Blue Snowberry in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Green Snowberry in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Purple Snowberry in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Yellow Snowberry in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Green Spiky Grass in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Purple Spiky Grass in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Yellow Spiky Grass in both 1 & 2 meshes + ingredient
Blue Thistle + ingredient
Pink Thistle + ingredient
White Thistle + ingredient
Yellow Thistle + ingredient
Blue Tundra Cotton + ingredient
Purple Tundra Cotton + ingredient
Yellow Tundra Cotton + ingredient


Included in 1.2

Each of the sword fern meshes in four colors
Each of the Fall Forest fern clusters in three colors



Included in 1.4
removed ferns

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Change log:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

1.0
Release

1.1
Added esp file that was forgotten.
Changed meshes to correspond with vanilla meshes. 01 to 01, and so on.

1.2

Added recolored sword ferns & Fall Forest ferns since I was not thinking and used the same esp for the ferns. The ferns wrap around the front of Jorrvaskr, there wasn't enough room to make it look nice in the back. Fixed unintentional switch of the pink lavender texture, harvest disabling should work now.

1.3
Removed vanilla mountain flower meshes accidentally put in file and fixed the pink lavender, yet again. Mountain flower 2 is now using the right nif file.


1.4
Removed ferns
Fixed the tundra cotton ingredients to show the proper files.
Changed the nif file structure so they are in different folders and easier to find.
The blue thistle should not bleed as much, that's the best I can do.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Requests:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Anyone who can fix nav meshes willing to try out my house mod would be greatly appreciated. Seriously.


You may ask for another color of the default meshes, but there is no guarantee that it will look nice. Some colors, like white, just don't show up right on the image files.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Installation:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

1) Extract the contents of the ZIP folder into a temporary folder
2) Cut & Paste files to your Data folder
3) Turn on the mod or use the CK to add the items to your mod.
4) Have fun


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Un-Installation:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

1) Delete the files associated with the mod
2) Remove any meshes used from your .esp



~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Incompatibility:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Any mod that changes the grounds behind Jorrvaskr, if you do decide to use the mod, otherwise none.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Bugs:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The Blue Thistle has a little bleeding that causes parts of the flowers to still show when harvested. Some of the other meshes had the same issue, but I think I've fixed them all. Let me know if I've missed one and I will fix it as I have time.

I make no guarantee that your computer will not explode, or the apocalypse will not come if you use my mod.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Credits:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

To The Good Lord
Bethesda for creating Skyrim.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Tools Used:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Nifskope
GIMP
CK

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Usage:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

You may use these files for your mod as long as you do not use them for adult content mods.

You may not use my files if you plan to ask for a donation or charge for your mod.

Otherwise, you do not have to ask for permission but please credit me with a link back to this upload.

You may NOT upload this file to any other site without my permission. You may not put them in any compilation of resources without my permission. It's not that I will say no, but I'm nosy and like to see other people's work.

Please do be kind and leave me a link so I may view your work.
author: Mentha
